title: As Naomi’s TikTok followers grew so did racist abuse
description: After the death of George Floyd student Naomi Eluwa found she needed to change her TikTok content.

title: The Nigerian filmmakers risking jail with lesbian movie Ife
description: The film board in Nigeria, where same-sex relationships are banned, says the film violates strict laws on homosexuality.

title: Ship with no crew to sail across the Atlantic
description: A full-size, crewless research ship is to make one of the world's first autonomous transatlantic voyages.

title: Coronavirus in Africa: Explaining the bogus 'viral blockers' worn by some politicians
description: BBC Africa explains the facts behind 'protective badges' that some politicians have been wearing.

title: Blind veteran writes cookery book for other visually-impaired people
description: Ex-Royal Marine Simon Mahoney says he hopes the book will help blind people to start cooking.

title: When changing a light bulb is a really big deal
description: Lighthouses have been upgrading to more efficient LED lights, but for some that is a step too far.

title: Social mobility: ‘When we set up a tech firm in Sheffield people laughed’
description: The Social Mobility Commission is demanding that more is done to boost children's chances.

title: Five reasons why Israel's peace deals with the UAE and Bahrain matter
description: Gulf states see opportunities for trade while Israel lessens its isolation, writes Jeremy Bowen.

title: Coronavirus: Could UK adopt German pay top-up scheme?
description: Instead of inventing a job support scheme for the pandemic, Germany already had one oven-ready.

title: Coronavirus: The family hit hard by unemployment
description: All the adults in the Coombes family from Liverpool have lost jobs due to coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus: The women who started businesses in lockdown
description: Young entrepreneurs explain how they changed tack during the pandemic and started their own firms.

title: Digital divide: 'My children's classroom is our car'
description: During the coronavirus pandemic, life has turned to the internet. But not everyone has it.

title: Seal joins in with River Witham paddleboard lesson
description: The seal hitched a ride on a paddleboard during a lesson on the River Witham in Lincolnshire.

title: Venus: Will private firms win the race to the fiery planet?
description: With interest in the possibility of life at Venus, there's an imperative to get more spacecraft to the planet.

title: Fifth ex-PM speaks out against post-Brexit bill
description: David Cameron says he has "misgivings" about government proposals to override the withdrawal deal agreed last year with the EU.

title: England have not forgotten about Black Lives Matter - Archer
description: Criticism of the England players by West Indies great Michael Holding was "a bit harsh", says pace bowler Jofra Archer.

title: Coronavirus: Sir Keir Starmer self-isolating after household 'symptoms'
description: The Labour leader will not speak in the Commons Brexit debate as he follows coronavirus guidelines.

title: Coronavirus: Report 'rule of six' breaches, minister urges
description: It comes as England, Scotland and Wales introduce limits on gatherings, with some key differences.

title: Guernsey Pride: The first 'in person' Pride event this year
description: Guernsey held the British Isles' first "in person" Pride event since the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Leighton Buzzard gets second earthquake in a week
description: The British Geological Survey says the 2.1-magnitude quake was felt just after midnight on Monday.

title: Bernadette Walker's parents charged with murder
description: Bernadette Walker, 17, was reported missing from Peterborough on 21 July.

title: US West Coast fires: Row over climate change's role as Trump visits
description: Governors say the president is in denial about climate change's role in the massive wildfires there.

title: Manchester Arena Inquiry: Relatives present 'pen portraits'
description: Families share a "moving" personal insight into those who died in the Manchester bombing.

title: Wasps' remarkable turnaround, Leinster's dominance & Farrell's ban
description: BBC rugby union correspondent Chris Jones ponders Wasps' Premiership success, Leinster's dominance and whether Owen Farrell's five-match ban was the right decision.

title: Coronavirus: Monoclonal antibodies to begin UK trial
description: Laboratory-made antibodies are to be trialled on 2,000 people with coronavirus in UK hospitals.

title: Coronavirus in Scotland: What are the latest lockdown rules?
description: The Scottish government has paused the next set of changes to lockdown rules and toughened some existing measures.

title: Kaepernick criticises NFL 'propaganda' and 'blackballing' of Reid
description: Colin Kaepernick criticises NFL "propaganda" and claims it is "blackballing" Eric Reid, who first protested alongside him.

title: West End musicals: Socially-distanced shows reveal reopening plans
description: Everybody's Talking About Jamie and Six will be the first musicals back in the West End in November.

title: ARM: UK-based chip designer sold to US firm Nvidia
description: The new owner of the Cambridge-based chip designer has promised to keep its headquarters in the UK.

title: Wetherspoon: 66 staff test positive across 50 pubs
description: The firm dismisses claims pubs are "dangerous" after some workers contract the virus after reopening.

title: NFL plays of the week: Aaron Rodgers, Julio Jones and a Tom Brady pick-six
description: Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers looks back to his best, producing some stunning throws in the opening week of the new NFL season, while Tom Brady struggles in his first game for Tampa Bay.

title: 'I dedicated my whole life to this' - new US Open champion Thiem
description: US Open champion Dominic Thiem says his "whole life" has been dedicated to winning his maiden Grand Slam title.

title: Naomi Osaka: How a shy introvert has found her voice to become tennis' new leader
description: The softly spoken Naomi Osaka is finding her voice to become a leader on and off the tennis court, after her second US Open title.

title: The Papers: Tory 'rebellion' and lockdown 'blow' to health
description: Several of Monday's papers lead with this week's parliamentary "showdown" over the Brexit bill.

title: Humpback whales enter crocodile river 'in Australian first'
description: At least one humpback whale remains in the Australian river after getting lost.
